mods.identifier: Postcard Collection, filed under Knoxville - Buildings.
mods.abstract: International Visitors Center, Knoxville, TN. Color postcard. Made by Dexter Press Inc. West Hyack, NY. Published by Newmanâ€™s in Knoxville. 88863-B. Color. 1 Pc. .RPPC (Real photo postcard). The Tennessee Valley Authority created the International Visitors Center in Knoxville in 1963 to accommodate the large number of foreign visitors who came to visit its headquarters. An estimated 10 per cent of all foreign visitors to the U. S. came to Knoxville in the 1960s, ranking it fifth behind Washington, D.C., Detroit, San Francisco, and New York. The Center smoothed the way for travel arrangements for foreign visitors and, more importantly, shielded them from "Jim Crow" racism they might otherwise encounter. (Robert Rook, "Race, Water, and Foreign Policy: The Tennessee Valley Authority's Global Agenda Meets "Jim Crow" in Diplomatic History, vol. 28).

name.namePart: Dexter Press Inc. West Hyack, NY
